name: OpenGammaTool
tagline: A tool for loading, graphing, and saving log files from an USB-enabled GammaScout geiger counter
body:
### A simple way to connect to your Gamma Scout
A cross-platform application that features an intuitive interface that lets you:
* Graph historical data
* Set the device time
* Save data to CSV format
* Save PNG, JPG, SVG, EPS, and PDF images of your graph.
* Use logarithmic or linear scale
* Show counts per minute or micro Sievert per hour
* Erase device memory
* See the amount of device memory used


### Simple installation
Just download the [latest release](https://github.com/erikjber/opengammatool/releases), put it anywhere and double-click it.


### Authors and Contributors
Written by Erik Berglund (@erikjber) using the protocol documents by [Johannes Bauer](http://johannes-bauer.com/linux/gammascout/).

### Support or Contact
Having problems? Please file a bug report!

### Gamma Scout
Gamma Scout geiger counters are available from [their website.](http://www.gammascout.com/)
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
